title: Cyclist dies in crash near Oxford Parkway station and Covid test centre
article: A cyclist has died in a crash with a lorry on a busy route, close to a train station. The woman, who was in her 40s, was injured at the junction of Oxford Road and Oxford Parkway station at about 08:00 GMT and died at the scene.Her family has been informed, Thames Valley Police said. Oxford Road and a nearby Covid-19 testing centre were closed to vehicles after the crash but reopened at about 13:00. No-one has been arrested.Thames Valley Police has appealed for any witnesses to get in touch, especially those who have dashcam footage which could help its investigation.Follow BBC South on Facebook , Twitter , or Instagram . Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk .
